data.title: Decent food
data.text: Food is decent with good options. Ran in for lunch on a Friday at 1:00. Line was pretty long but it moved quickly. They have an efficient system in place. Good options...taco, burrito, bowls, quesadillas and all the fixings. Food is fresh.

data.title: Excellent food and service with a smile!
data.text: The food was great, affordably priced and the service was excellent.  I was staying nearby and just walked over for dinner.  Would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Good Mexican, low prices, large portions.
data.text: Good Burritos, tacos and Mexican style salads, large portions and low prices.  Crowded and noisy at lunch hours with long lines, but service is usually fast.

data.title: Average
data.text: I go when I have a really good coupon. All the food tastes the same to me there, no matter what I get. And all the menu offerings are the same as many similar competitors. Employees are burrito assemblers basically, sometimes a smile but no frills. They do get busy during peak times, so the line requires some patience.

data.title: Good but not great Mexican Food
data.text: Located on Glades Road across from one of their competitors (Chipotle), this restaurant is very much similar to their competitor on terms of building your own burrito. They have more options than Chipotle on terms of toppings to put on your burritos and even include free chips with a few choices to pick along with them. While it sounds like a bargain, the quality of the food is a little better at Chipotle although I do like both of them as options for quick serve Mexican Food. For Moe's I always get the Homewrecker as I'm being greeted "Welcome to Moes" by all the front line staff. Very friendly customer service and I will be returning.

data.title: Fast, Fresh Mexican Food!
data.text: Great concept that allows you to choose what and how much of an ingredient goes into your burrito. Everything always tastes so fresh. You will be sure to be greeted with a "Welcome to Moe's" when you come through the doors. Monday night offers a $5.99 burrito or burrito bowl and a $.99 drink. Great salsa bar included as well as free chips. Be sure to sign up for their loyalty program as every tenth burrito you purchase gets you a free entree.

data.title: Way Better Than Chipolte
data.text: I am going to Moe's for now on when I want inexpensive Mexican.  They give you chips with every order, have coupons, have a loyalty program and have a great salsa bar.  So much better than Chipolte.  PLUS there is rarely a wait and their staff members are friendly, neither of which I experience at the area Chipoltes.

data.title: Build your own burrito
data.text: A build your own burrito place.  Good value for the volume of food you get. I prefer having the bowl instead of the burrito.

data.title: Quick and easy southwest style food
data.text:
After reviewing the menu on the wall as you arrive at Moe's, you join a line and walk along the buffet style row where staff will add the ingredients to your dish as requested.
A wide variety of toppings are available for the basic burrito, quesadilla, taco, etc. style of shell for holding your individually designed meal. Although there is only one line to proceed down, the staff is friendly and effective at fulfilling your request. The food is flavorful, generous portions for the price, and provides a nice alternative to burger style restaurants.

data.title: Love Moe's
data.text: Moe's makes the best burrito around for franchise-type restaurants in my opinion; much better than the other place and they don't charge extra for guacamole either.

data.title: Good Food, Good Prices, Full Belly
data.text: Moe's is a great stop-by place to get a good meal at a great price. Don't order Chips and Salsa, everyone gets some with every meal. and they have a variety of salsa's to choose from.  Almost every budget can find something on the menu to afford.  That's why there are almost always a bunch of FAU Students there to grab a bite to eat.  I've has many different variety of menu items, and have not been disappointed yet.

data.title: Good food at cheap prices
data.text: This is a chain, but you know what you're getting and the food is tasty and filling. You have lots of options on what to include in your burrito. Also you can usually order the children's size (which is plenty!) even if you're an adult.

data.title: A side of rudeness
data.text: The food here is decent. The atmosphere is ok. A few of the service people are AWFUL. There is one woman in particular who is always angry! It makes me want to ask why she even comes to work. She is literally doing more damage than good here. It's still a good place, just expect rudeness.

data.title: Beards, and no passion
data.text: As other establishments enforce the practice of wearing a hat, restraining hair and if a beard is in question...go shave or wear protection, not here.  It was quite a disgusting site to watch the young man diving into the ingredients with the scraggly hairs dangling effortlessly off of his chin.  We are seasoned Moes patrons and this is by far the worst one we encountered.  Besides the fact he took no pride in his ability to be  a burrito artist as we have found at other Moes.  Just disappointing!  The girl who made my taco had no clue how to make it into a salad since I always forego the shell.  Lack of experience and desire to please the customers dietary needs .  Won't be going back ever again.  Btw ...not one the crew said Welcome to Moes.  Zero passion for their job.  Zero!

data.title: Chipotle is better
data.text: always too crowded, not as good as chipotle in all ways, the food is not as good, the service is not as good and won't go back

data.title: Yummy!!!
data.text: Had the salad with chicken, servers were  wry friendly. Also chips with guac and my daughter had the beef burrito and chips and queso All was great!

data.title: good again
data.text: we stopped in here and were pleasently surprised at the service and the freshness of the food. the location is good as well.

data.title: Good food and quick serivce
data.text: Typical tex-mex, but we go here because the food is less spicy and more variety than the competition. They offer a free salsa bar. Seating is a bit dirty and they are busy from the college crowd a lot!

data.title: Just ok
data.text: We only come here for 5$ burrito Mondays. Honestly the food has no flavor, especially the meat. Don't really care for the free chips, not only are they skimpy on it but they are ALWAYS cooked in bad oil that needs to be changed, you can tell by the after taste. The salsas at the salsa bar have no taste as well, tastes like tomatoes and water. The service is also always super slow on burrito Mondays, they have 6-8 people working in the front but the line is out the door and it takes 20-30 minutes to get to the front to order. If I see that line wrapped around I don't even think about parking sometimes, I go somewhere else. You can have all natural, organic food (if its even true) but if it has no flavor then I could honestly care less.

data.title: Just ok for fast food place
data.text: The staff is always friendly and the food is just ok. The place is super busy because of the location in near proximity to the local universities.
